Class GUIPlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • userinterface.GUIPlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, PrismSettingsListener, GUIEventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GUIClipboard, GUIFileMenu, GUILog, GUIMultiModel, GUIMultiProperties, GUINetwork, GUISimulator

    public abstract class GUIPlugin
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements GUIEventListener, PrismSettingsListener
    This abstract class should be overridden to implement a component to be plugged in to the PRISM GUI. It extends JPanel so that it can be directly added to the tabbed pane within a GUIPrism object. A subclass should provide implementations for access methods which will contain information concerning:
    • Whether the plugin should be displayed as a tab,
    • The display text for that tab,
    • A Menu (added to the top of the GUI)
    • An Options Panel (added to the options dialog contained within the GUI)
    • Any File Filters
    A subclass should also be able to handle GUIEvents by implementing the processGUIEvent method, which will be called whenever a GUIEvent is generated via the event handler associated with the GUIPrism object.
    This class provides access to all utilities that may be required by the components:
    • Error messages
    • Message dialogs
    • Option dialogs
    • File choosers
    • Setting the taskbar text
    • Notifying other plugins of GUIEvents
    • Setting the state of the progress bar
    • Making log entries
    • Enabling this plugin
    • Switching this plugin to the front of the gui
    • Switching the log of the gui to the front
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        private Prism prism

      • selectionChangeHandler

        protected GUIEventHandler selectionChangeHandler
        Whenever the state of the cut/copy/delete/selectall buttons should change notify this handler. This will in turn call the canDoClipBoardAction to determine which buttons should be enabled.

      • processGUIEvent

        public abstract boolean processGUIEvent(GUIEvent e)
        When a GUIEvent is generated from some other GUIPlugin object or the parent GUIPrism object, if this plugin has been assigned to listen to events, this method is called. It should be implemented to handle GUIEvents. Note this method will catch GUIEvents generated from this class, so be careful to avoid recursive effects. An implementation should return false by default, unless the event should not be passed on to any more listeners, in which case it should returns true.
        Specified by:
        processGUIEvent in interface GUIEventListener
        Parameters:
        e - A GUIEvent from elsewhere in the userinterface.

      • optionPane

        public int optionPane(java.lang.String message,
                      java.lang.String title,
                      int buttonType,
                      int messageType,
                      java.lang.String[] choices,
                      java.lang.String defa)
        A utility method to display an option pane and return the resulting selection.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be displayed.
        title - The title of the option pane.
        buttonType - The type of button to be used. Use JOptionPane button type constants.
        messageType - The type of message to be displayed. Use JOptionPane message type constants
        choices - A String Array of the choices to be placed on the buttons of the option pane.
        defa - The default selection string.
        Returns:
        Returns the index of the selected button. The index is the corresponding index of the selection in 'choices'.
